title: Overview
description: An introduction to @aigne/cli, its main features, and the problems it solves for agent development.

title: Getting Started
description: A step-by-step guide to installing the CLI and creating and running your first AIGNE project.

title: Core Concepts
description: Explains the fundamental concepts of an AIGNE project, including its structure and key configuration files.

title: Project Configuration (aigne.yaml)
description: Details the main project configuration file `aigne.yaml`, including chat model settings, agent definitions, and skill integrations.

title: Agents and Skills
description: Covers the definition and structure of agents and skills, the core executable components of an AIGNE project.

title: Command Reference
description: A detailed reference for all available CLI commands and their options, organized for quick look-up.

title: aigne create
description: Scaffolds a new AIGNE project from a template.

title: aigne run
description: Executes an agent locally or from a remote URL, with options for chat mode, model selection, and input handling.

title: aigne serve-mcp
description: Serves agents as a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for integration with external systems.

title: aigne hub
description: Manages connections to the AIGNE Hub, allowing you to switch accounts, check status, and use Hub-provided models.

title: aigne observe
description: Starts a local server to view and analyze agent execution traces and observability data.

title: aigne test
description: Runs automated tests for your agents and skills.

title: aigne deploy
description: Deploys an AIGNE application as a Blocklet to a specified endpoint.

title: Built-in Apps
description: Execute pre-packaged applications like `doc-smith` for specialized, out-of-the-box agent functionality.

title: Guides
description: Practical guides for accomplishing common development tasks with @aigne/cli.

title: Creating a Custom Agent
description: A step-by-step tutorial on creating a new JavaScript agent and integrating it into your project as a skill.

title: Running Remote Agents
description: Learn how to run agents directly from a remote Git repository or tarball URL.

title: Deploying Agents
description: Learn how to deploy your AIGNE project as a Blocklet for production use.

title: Contributing
description: Guidelines for contributing to the @aigne/cli project, including setup, build process, and code standards.
